author: Adam Voge
title: Condo conundrum in downtown Minneapolis
text:
Home / News / Construction & Development / Condo conundrum in downtown Minneapolis The eight-year-old Carlyle condo tower, at 100 Third Ave. S. in downtown Minneapolis, was the site of a record-high condo sale this year. The buyer in that case paid $1,200 per square foot, or $4.3 million total. (Staff photo: Bill Klotz) Condo conundrum in downtown Minneapolis By: Adam Voge July 22, 2015 7:06 am 0 Realtors see big demand. Developers see big risks. User Name/E-mail: Password:
